citation.article-title: Methermicoccus shengliensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a thermophilic, methylotrophic methanogen isolated from oil-production water, and proposal of Methermicoccaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Methermicoccus shengliensis sp. nov.
Methermicoccus shengliensis (shen.gli.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. shengliensis pertaining to Shengli oilfield, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are small, motile cocci with a diameter of 0.7–1.0 μm.
Cells occur in clusters of two to four cells, and sometimes form cysts during the exponential phase.
Cells are lysed in SDS (0.01 %, w/v) and H2O, but not in PBS (0.2 M) or NaCl solution (0.9 %, w/v).
Only methanol, methylamine and trimethylamine are used as substrates for methanogenesis.
Fast growth occurs at pH 6.0–6.5 (range for growth, pH 5.5–8.0), 65 °C (range for growth, 50–70 °C), 0.3–0.5 M NaCl (range for growth, 0.2–1.1 M) and 0.05–0.20 M MgCl2.
The DNA G+C content is 56 mol%.
The type strain, ZC-1T (=CGMCC 1.5056T=DSM 18856T), was isolated from oil-production water of Shengli oilfield, China.
